intro: Spergularia macrotheca, commonly known as the large-leaf sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or arid environments. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers with five petals, and its leaves are usually lobed and succulent. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its thick, fleshy leaves. Spergularia macrotheca is also known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a common species in disturbed or coastal habitats.
